Posts.Content: Kadi wrote: Hello to all I have recently been diagnosed with metastatic breast cancer to the left lung, spine and liver.  I was a  9 year survivor and really did think I had it beat, but I guess that wasn't in the cards.  It hid under other symptoms like arthritis and flu.  When I finally realized that something really wasn't right, my symptoms were aggressive and getting worse fast.  I became so short of breath that I could hardly take a shower without passing out.  And the coughing was almost non-stop.  You'd think that with my history, I would've been more aware of what my body was trying to tell me, but I honestly thought that the arthritis in my back was just getting worse with age and that I had the "creeping crud" that everybody in town had.  When my GP ordered a chest xray, then everthing became crystal clear and thus began the franic parade of dr. appointments, scans, port placement,etc (you all know what I'm talking about).  So I will be following this board with interest and hope to make some new friends along the way.  Hugs to all! Dx 2/20/2014, Stage IV, Grade 3, mets, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Here we go again......... Kadi WanderingSpirit

Posts.Content: Mar 25, 2014 11:08AM Kadi wrote: Thanks everyone for the warm welcome.  I'm so glad I found you!!   I actually started my tx 4 weeks ago, which is Halaven, 2 weeks on and 1 week off.  I go tomorrow for my 3rd tx.  I already feel so much better than I did.  The coughing has mostly subsided and the shortness of breath is not as bad.  I feel like I've gotton a "grip" on this thing now.  I was put on a steroid for a week and don't know if that quieted my symptoms or if the Halaven is doing the trick.  But no matter which, I'm so thankful for the relief of those symptoms.  I honestly thought that the dx had come too late and that I was close to the end.  My outlook today compared to 2 weeks ago has changed 200%!  But I have a feeling with this disease, outlooks change frequently. Thanks again for your comforting words and I look forward to learning more from you about the journey I've begun.
Posts.Title: Here we go again......... Kadi WanderingSpirit
